definition:
the terminal part of the vertebrate forelimb when modified (as in humans) as a grasping organ : the body part at the end of the arm of a human, ape, or monkey                                      
             
             holding a pair of scissors in his hand
the forelimb segment (such as the terminal section of a bird's wing) of a vertebrate higher than the fishes that corresponds to the hand irrespective of its form or functional specialization
something resembling a hand: such as

an indicator or pointer on a dial                                      
             
             the hands of a clock
a character ☞ used to direct particular attention (as to a note or paragraph) : fist, index
a cluster of bananas developed from a single flower group
a branched rootstock of ginger
a bunch of large leaves (as of tobacco) tied together usually with another leaf
a part serving the function of or resembling a hand: such as
the hind foot of an ape
the chela of a crustacean

personal possession                                      
                
                  —usually used in plural          The documents fell into the hands of the enemy.

control, supervision                                      
                
                  —usually used in plural          left the matter in her hands

one of two sides or aspects of an issue or argument                                      
             
             On the one hand we can appeal for peace, and on the other, declare war.

side, direction                                      
             
             soldiers fighting on either hand

assistance or aid especially involving physical effort                                      
             
             lend a hand

participation, interest                                      
             
             had no hand in the decision

a round of applause                                      
             
             Let's give them a big hand.

skill, ability                                      
             
             tried her hand at sailing

an instrumental part                                      
             
             had a hand in the victory

a pledge especially of betrothal or bestowal in marriage                                      
             
             He asked for her hand in marriage.

the cards or pieces held by a player                                      
             
             studied her hand
a player in a card game or board game

a single round in a game                                      
             
             lost the first hand but won the next two

the force or solidity of one's position (as in negotiations)                                      
             
             trying to strengthen their hand

a person employed at manual labor or general tasks                                      
             
             a ranch hand

worker, employee                                      
             
             employed over a hundred hands

a member of a ship's crew                                      
             
             All hands on deck!

a person who performs or executes a particular work                                      
             
             two portraits by the same hand

a person skilled in a particular action or pursuit                                      
             
             a great hand at carpentry

a specialist or veteran in a usually designated activity or region                                      
             
             a Latin America hand

style of execution : workmanship                                      
             
             the hand of a master

handiwork, doings                                      
             
             the hand of vandals
the feel of or tactile reaction to something (such as silk or leather)

style of penmanship : handwriting                                      
             
             wrote in a fancy hand
signature

a unit of measure equal to 4 inches (10.2 centimeters) used especially for the height of horses                                      
             
             a horse that is 15 hands high

a punch made with a specified hand                                      
             
             knocked him out with a good right hand

near in time or place : within reach                                      
             
             use whatever ingredients are at hand

currently receiving or deserving attention                                      
             
             the business at hand

by or through the action of                                      
             
             suffering at the hands of a cruel dictator
with the hands or a hand-worked implement (such as a tool or pen) rather than with a machine

from one individual directly to another                                      
             
             deliver the document by hand

in one's possession or control                                      
             
             had matters well in hand

in preparation                                      
             
             a new play in hand

under consideration                                      
             
             took the matter in hand

everywhere                                      
             
             could hear scurrying noises on all hands

in present possession or readily available                                      
             
             kept supplies on hand

in attendance : present                                      
             
             A priest was on hand to console them.

about to appear : pending                                      
             
             There was trouble on hand.

in one's possession or care                                      
             
             too much time on my hands

out of control                                      
             
             They let the situation get out of hand.
without delay or deliberation
done with : finished

with the hands                                      
             
             fruit eaten out of hand

within reach                                      
             
             weapons ready to hand

into possession                                      
             
             The letter … has come to hand …

to give, pass, or transmit with the hand                                      
             
             hand a letter to her

to present or provide with                                      
             
             handed him a surprise

to lead, guide, or assist with the hand                                      
             
             hand a lady into a bus

furl                                      
             
             hand the sail
to touch or manage with the hands

to give credit to : concede the excellence of                                      
             
             I have to hand it to him. He did a wonderful job.

with the hands rather than by machine                                      
             
             hand stitched
(Billings) Learned 1872–1961 American jurist
the body part at the end of your arm that includes your fingers and thumb
—used in some phrases to refer to a person
power, possession, or control
to give (something) to someone using your hands
the body part at the end of the human arm that includes the fingers and thumb
a bodily structure (as the hind foot of an ape) like the human hand in function or form
a pointer on a clock or watch

help entry 2 sense 1, assistance                                      
             
             I gave her a hand loading the truck.

control entry 2 sense 1                                      
             
             The fort is in the hands of the enemy.

one side of a problem                                      
             
             On the one hand we could stay. On the other hand we could go.

an outburst of applause                                      
             
             Give them a hand.
the cards held by a player in a card game
a hired worker : laborer
a promise of marriage
handwriting

ability sense 1                                      
             
             I tried my hand at painting.

a unit of measure equal to four inches (about ten centimeters)                                      
             
             The horse is 15 hands high.

a part or share in doing something                                      
             
             She had a hand in the crime.

near in time or place                                      
             
             The hour is at hand.

without the use of automation : using the hands                                      
                

            The stone was carved by hand.

in someone's possession or control                                      
             
             Map in hand, he's ready to go.

available for use                                      
             
             Keep some extra batteries on hand.

present entry 3 sense 2                                      
                

            Please be on hand when the guests arrive.

out of control                                      
             
             The party got out of hand.

to give or pass with the hand                                      
                

            Please hand me the knife.

definition: the part of your body at the end of each arm that you use for picking up and holding things
various hand positions in emoji form, often used to represent established hand gestures and their meanings. They are also used to show feelings or tone of voice in written communication.
someone who does physical work
someone who works on a farm
someone who works on a ship
help
if people give someone a hand, they clap their hands to show that they have enjoyed a performance
the particular set of cards that have been given to you in a game of cards
the advantages you have that give you a chance to be successful in a particular situation
the hands on a clock are the long parts that move round and show the time
a unit for measuring how tall a horse is
someone’s handwriting
to reveal information everyone wants to get, especially inadvertently so
to be lucky/unlucky in life
used to indicate that someone is very unwilling to give something up
to help someone
in: Mrs Bennet put her hands over her ears to shut out the noise.
have​/​hold something in your hand: He was holding a mug of coffee in his left hand.
hold someone’s hand: He sat by the bed and held her hand.
hold hands  (=hold each other’s hands): The park was full of young couples holding hands.
take someone by the hand: George took her by the hand and helped her out of the car.
hand in hand  (=holding each other’s hand): They walked along the cliff top hand in hand.
shake hands: The two men introduced themselves and shook hands.
It was a large farm, with over 20 hired hands.
give someone a hand  (=help someone): Can you give me a hand with these boxes?
like​/​want​/​need a hand: Would you like a hand with the cleaning up?
lend a hand  (=help): Lydia lent a hand  (=helped) with the costumes.
a big hand for someone: A big hand for the band, ladies and gentlemen!
give someone a big hand: Let’s give the children a big hand.
play your hand  (=use your advantages): Everything depends on how the company plays its hand.
The manuscript was written in the author’s own hand.
at hand
at the hands of someone
by hand
first/second/third hand
get/lay your hands on something
go hand in hand
hand in glove
someone’s hand in marriage
hand over fist
someone’s hands are tied
hands off
hands up
have a hand in something
have someone/something on your hands
have time on your hands
have your hands full
in hand
in someone’s hands
keep your hand in
keep your hands off
off your hands
on the one hand...on the other hand
on (your) hands and knees
out of hand
out of your hands
put your hands together for someone
sit on your hands
take/get your hands off
take someone in hand
to hand
turn your hand to something

definition: the part of the body at the end of the arm that is used for holding, moving, touching, and feeling things:
one of the long, thin pieces that point to the numbers on a clock or watch:
a (single part of a) game of cards, or the set of cards that a player has in a game:
help with doing something that needs a lot of effort:
a person who does physical work or is skilled or experienced in something:
a sailor:
involvement in or influence over an event:
clapping for a performer:
a person's writing:
a unit for measuring the height of a horse up to its shoulder:
to put something into someone's hand from your own hand:
the part of the body at the end of the arm that includes the fingers and is used for holding, moving, touching, and feeling things:
one of the two long narrow parts on a clock or watch that move to show the time:
the set of cards that a player is given in a game:
help with doing something:
a person who does physical work, esp. as one of a team or group:
a period of clapping to show enjoyment of a performance:
to put something from your hand into someone else’s hand:
someone employed to do physical work:
always happening or being done together:
working closely with someone:
available:
being worked on or dealt with at the present time:
made or done using your hands rather than a machine:
delivered by a person, rather than sent in the mail:
to find or get someone or something you want:
able to make or do things well with your hands:
already available or being done:
being dealt with or looked after by a particular person or group of people:
controlled or owned by a particular person or group of people:
available and ready to help or be used if necessary:
no longer able to be controlled by you, or no longer your responsibility:
to give money to someone or to a charity:
the job or subject that is important at the present time:
near and able to be used:
in: All their toys are made by hand.

definition: An alternative to having a girlfriend

Marginalized Orientations, Gender identities, And Intersex. it’s meant to be an all inclusive umbrella term for asexuals, homosexuals, multisexuals, trans people, and intersex people. Alternative to LGBTQIAP+
Alternative to MOGII, easier to pronounce.
Short for Have A Nice Day.

When somebody says or does something stupid, "hands" is called on them. The person that called it gets to slap the other person's hand. If somebody calls "brakes" then it cancels out "hands", therefore one would call "hands, no brakes" to prevent that from happening.
Have a Nice Day. Common sign-off at the end of a tech support forum post, often used in conjunction with HTH. Also used (ineffectively) to placate those for whom no help is available.
The ability to catch a football very easily, and barely ever drop it no matter the difficulty.
A person who can catch a football easily or exceptionally well.
